title: Insurance catastrophe declared in southeast Queensland | 7NEWS
description: Southeast Queensland has been declared an insurance catastrophe following severe thunderstorms with gale force winds and enormous hailstones. Over 16,000 insurance claims have been lodged, with the SES receiving more than 500 calls for help since yesterday. Thousands remain without power across the Sunshine Coast, Caboolture and Bribie Island areas, while heatwave conditions are forecast until Friday. title: Major changes coming to Australia's 2026 census | 7NEWS
description: The Australian Bureau of Statistics has announced significant changes to the 2026 national census, scheduled for Tuesday, August 11. New questions will include sex recorded at birth, current gender identity, sexual identity, and transportation methods including bike and e-bike usage for work commutes. Australians will also be able to list up to four cultural heritages, with the first batch of results to be released in June 2027. title: New questions on gender identity and sexuality in 2026 census
description: Australians will be asked questions about their gender identity and sexuality in next year's census to deliver what authorities and equality advocates say is a more complete picture of "who we are as a nation". #census #gender #sexuality #identity #population

title: 'Turning our children to witchcraft': Pokemon card craze grips Australia in 1999 | 7NEWS VAULT
description: With the new Pokemon Phantasmal Flame series release, we look back at how Pokemon cards became Australia's biggest toy craze in 1999. Australians were spending $11 million in just two months on the trading card game based on Nintendo's Pocket Monsters franchise. The phenomenon sparked widespread concern among parents, teachers and church leaders who worried about children gambling with cards, stealing from each other, and spending lunch money on rare cards worth up to $85. Many schools banned Pokemon cards due to playground fights and disruption, while experts debated whether the collecting craze was harmless social interaction or encouraged problematic behaviour patterns.
